message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.DS 

The paper discusses ongoing research in channel coding, which is a subfield of information theory (cs.IT). The three areas of research mentioned in the abstract, spatially coupled LDPC codes, non-binary LDPC codes, and polar coding, are all topics that fall under the umbrella of coding theory (cs.CC). The use of spatially coupled codes is also relevant to signal processing (cs.SI). Non-binary LDPC codes involve the use of finite fields, which is a topic in number theory (cs.NI). Finally, the paper discusses the use of algorithms and computational techniques to optimize coding schemes, which is relevant to the field of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS).
